main event: On multiple occasions in 1956, unidentified objects were observed in the skies over Rocky Ford, Colorado, exhibiting unusual movements and characteristics.
interesting points: The objects were described as the size of a dime and appeared to be red, yellow, and green in color, forming a stationary formation with flashing lights.
One report mentioned the object hovering, moving irregularly, and appearing to be elliptical in shape.
Another report stated the object was visible for over 30 minutes and then proceeded north at a very high rate of speed.
The witnesses included civilians, a local civil defense patrol officer, and a military personnel.
The sighting was considered significant enough to warrant further investigation by the authorities.
witnesses: local civil defense patrol officers, military personnel, and civilians
